title: Lightning injuries in Northern Ireland
patient: The third victim was a 7-year-old girl walking on the right side of the adult at the time of injury. She also suffered a splash burn from the lightning, approximately 3.5% TBSA, on left upper limb, groin and exit burns on both feet. Keraunographic markings (Lichtenberg figures) were evident on both lower limbs. These were superficial partial thickness burns except a very small area of deep dermal burn at the left forearm. She did not suffer any other serious internal injuries. After six days of hospitalisation. She was discharged home with outpatient follow up plan. Her burns healed 18 days following the injury.
